info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 3:34PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING DOWN TO SEA LEVEL... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING ABOVE 500 FEET... * WHAT...Below 500 feet down to sea level, snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches is possible. Above 500 feet, heavy snow likely with snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches and up to 20 inches possible in higher terrain. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Elevations above 500 feet in the South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow down to sea level is possible again Sunday night, but amounts look to be lighter at this time. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
